meanings.definition: A building with no elevator, requiring occupants to walk up stairs to reach their apartments.
meanings.sent1: The walkups in the city are great for exercise.
meanings.sent2: I live in a walkup building, so I climb stairs every day.
meanings.sent3: The walkups in the old town have a lot of character.
meanings.sent4: Living in a walkup is like having a built-in workout every day.
meanings.sent5: The walkups in the neighborhood offer beautiful views from the top floors.

meanings.definition: A type of apartment that is accessed by walking up stairs from the ground floor.
meanings.sent1: She prefers walkups because they feel more cozy and private.
meanings.sent2: The walkup we visited had a charming spiral staircase.
meanings.sent3: The walkup apartment had a surprise waiting at the top of the stairs.
meanings.sent4: Living in a walkup is like having your own little retreat above the city.
meanings.sent5: The walkup on the corner has a lovely flower box by the entrance.
